1.text: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?

2.text: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.

3.text: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widowâ€™s ox for a pledge.

4.text: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.

5.text: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yields food for them and for their children.

6.text: They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.

7.text: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.

8.text: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.

9.text: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.

10.text: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;

11.text: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.

12.text: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded cries out: yet God lays not folly to them.

13.text: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.

14.text: The murderer rising with the light kills the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.

15.text: The eye also of the adulterer waits for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguises his face.

16.text: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.

17.text: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.

18.text: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholds not the way of the vineyards.

19.text: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so does the grave those which have sinned.

20.text: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.

21.text: He evil entreats the barren that bears not: and does not good to the widow.

22.text: He draws also the mighty with his power: he rises up, and no man is sure of life.

23.text: Though it be given him to be in safety, where on he rests; yet his eyes are on their ways.

24.text: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.

25.text: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?
